author: Sean Martin
title: Featured Groups: The Honda Classic
text:
Featured Groups: The Honda Classic February 21, 2017 By Sean Martin , PGATOUR.COM Follow @PGATOURSMartin Commercials PGA TOUR LIVE coverage of the 2017 Honda Classic Subscribe today at PGATOURLIVE.com to see the game's biggest stars in exclusive early-round coverage Thursday and Friday. Stay tuned for featured hole coverage from the PGA National. 
PALM BEACH GARDENS, Fla. – The PGA TOUR heads east this week for The Honda Classic, which annually presents one of the PGA TOUR’s toughest tests. PGA National’s par-70 Champion Course played to a 71.8 scoring average in 2016, the second-highest scoring average (in relation to par) on a non-major course. 
THE HONDA CLASSIC: Field | Tee Times | PGA TOUR LIVE 
PGA TOUR LIVE is scheduled to air from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. ET on Thursday and Friday. After Featured Groups, the coverage will switch to Featured Holes from 3 p.m. to 6 p.m. ET. The Featured Holes are the Bear Trap’s two par-3s, the water-lined 15th and 17th. 
PGA TOUR LIVE can be viewed on Twitter from approximately 7 a.m. to 8 a.m. ET on Thursday and Friday, as well. The live Twitter broadcast is available to watch here. 
Here’s a look at the Featured Groups that will be available on PGA TOUR LIVE this week ( Click here to subscribe ). FedExCup standings in parentheses for each player. THURSDAY 
Sergio Garcia (97), Zach Johnson (86), Paul Casey (37) : Three former Ryder Cup foes are in this group. Garcia was runner-up at last year’s Honda Classic, while Casey finished third in this event in 2015. Garcia, who won earlier this year at the Dubai Desert Classic, finished 49th at last week’s Genesis Open. Casey finished fifth in last season’s FedExCup. 
Tee time: 7:35 a.m. ET off No. 10 
Justin Thomas (2), Adam Scott (72), Padraig Harrington (193) : The past two Honda Classic champions are paired with this season’s only three-time winner. Thomas, who lives in nearby Jupiter, ranks second in the FedExCup after victories at the CIMB Classic, SBS Tournament of Champions and Sony Open in Hawaii. Thomas and Hideki Matsuyama have staked a large lead over the rest of the TOUR in the FedExCup standings. Thomas trails Matusyama by just 70 points, but is 680 points ahead of third-ranked Jordan Spieth. Scott, who’s coming off an 11th-place finish at last week’s Genesis Open, won last year’s Honda, while Harrington was victorious in a playoff over Daniel Berger in 2015. Scott, who’s No. 7 in the Official World Golf Ranking, is the highest-ranked player in the field. 
Tee time: 7:45 a.m. ET off No. 10 FRIDAY 
Jimmy Walker (91), Brooks Koepka (29), Martin Kaymer (NR): Walker, winner of the 2016 PGA Championship, highlights a group that includes another local player and a two-time major winner. Koepka was teammates with Berger at Florida State and also grew up near PGA National. Kaymer is a two-time major winner (2010 PGA; 2014 U.S. Open) and winner of THE PLAYERS Championship 2014. 
Tee time : 7:35 a.m. ET off No. 10 Hudson Swafford (10), Daniel Berger (19), Rickie Fowler (58): Local favorites Fowler and Berger are in this group, along with one of the TOUR’s recent young winners. Swafford, 29, earned his first victory at the CareerBuilder Challenge. Seven consecutive tournaments were won by players in their 20s before Dustin Johnson’s win Sunday at the Genesis Open. Berger, who grew up near PGA National, was runner up in this tournament in 2015. Fowler finished sixth in this tournament last year. 
Tee time: 7:45 a.m. ET off No. 10 MORE FROM PGA TOUR
